start: ^("Still so much to study... Maybe just one more book.")

bookOpened: ^Let's see what this weird book is about...
^Ow. That landing was less graceful than I hoped.
^I could ask you the same thing! But introductions first — I’m your new spirit companion, and you just opened a very special book.
^Nope. You just triggered a time-binding portal. This book doesn’t just *tell* history — it *connects* to it.
^Why would a book like that be here?
^That... is a long story. But I’m here to help. You and I? We're gonna make sure history stays on track.
^Just someone who’s tired of history always going the same way. Time for a rewrite.
^He’s trying to change the past. If we don’t follow him, everything could fall apart.
^Before we jump in, touch the book again. It’ll open the quest menu — you'll need it where we’re going.
villageStart: ^Somewhere old… really old. I don’t recognize the exact place yet, but the air smells like wood smoke and wet soil.
^Hey, I’m working with what we’ve got
^Look, there's a village nearby — let’s go there first
villageNPC1: ^You don’t look like you're from around here. You lost, child?
^I guess you could say that… What year is this?
^Year? It’s the 938th year of the common era. Strange question to ask.
villageNPC2: ^Your clothes look funny. Are you a time traveller?
^General Ngô Quyền, of course! He’s preparing to fight the Southern Han invaders.
^When I grow up I'm gonna join his force
villageNPC3: ^Careful near the river. The tides here are tricky - just what the General wants
^General Ngo Quyen, duh. He is preparing a trap for the enemies using the tides.
^Maybe you can help with that. Just join his force, it's open to all villagers
village_discuss: ^So… it’s the year 938. The Battle of Bạch Đằng.
^That’s a turning point. Ngô Quyền’s victory kept the Southern Han from taking over.
^Then the Villain might be trying to stop that.
^Most likely. If he changes the outcome here, a lot of history could fall apart.
^Then we should join Ngô Quyền. Help out.
^Yes, yes. But first — you can’t walk into camp looking like that.
^Something simple. Local. Try to blend in. And maybe… try not to get caught?
village_end: ^If you’re serious about helping, head west. Ngô Quyền’s camp is near the bamboo grove.
^That’s our lead. Let’s move — history won’t wait for us.
campStart: ^And look — soldiers. Training hard. This must be Ngô Quyền’s main force.
^They’re focused on drills right now. If we move quietly, we might just blend in…
^A stealth approach? Got it. Let’s go.
chatGeneral: ^Sorry for the intrusion. We just wanted to help.
^You move like a scout. Not bad. But you’re clearly not from around here.
^I’ve heard of your efforts, General. We want to join and support your cause.
^Hm. We need every able hand. The Southern Han will not wait.
^They’ve stationed themselves upriver. Word is, they've promoted a new general.
^Possibly. Then we must be swift. We’re setting a trap — stakes beneath the tide.
^But there’s still much to do. Help us prepare the stakes. The tide will soon be in our favor.
^Understood. Just point me where to start.
woodMaking: ^Not bad at all. You work fast.
^I’ve seen enough. I want your thoughts on the enemy’s next move.
riverStart: ^This is the Bạch Đằng River. It may look calm now, but it will decide the battle.
^At low tide, we strike. We plant stakes beneath the waterline — hidden from the enemy ships.
^Ingenious. The tide turns... and so will the war.
^I need your eyes. Scout the area. Mark where we should plant the stakes.
stakeDone: ^I've marked the key spots. Stakes here will block most of the river.
^Go back to camp and get some rest. You’ll need your strength.
^That’s the nicest way I’ve ever been told I look tired.
